prompts.description: Optimize the provided code for performance and readability.
prompts.template: Analyze the provided code and suggest optimizations for performance and readability. Ensure no functionality is lost. ...

prompts.description: Generate documentation for C# code following specific rules.
prompts.template:
In the referenced document, generate documentation in English for C# code following these rules:

For each object (class, interface, etc.):

Document the object header by analyzing its methods and properties.

For methods and properties only if no documentation is already present, apply the following:

Do not modify the method implementation, only add XML documentation.

Include a concise description of the methodâ€™s behavior in a <remarks> block.

Specify constraints and details for each parameter in <param> tags.

List all possible exceptions that can be thrown in <exception> tags.

If the method is public, include a properly formatted example inside an <example> tag using <code lang="C#">. Ensure code formatting is correct, and replace < characters in generics with >.

If the method returns a value (i.e., not void), describe the return value in a <returns> tag and include a <see> reference if applicable.

For each property, add documentation describing its usage and reference where it is used in the project.

prompts.description: Synthesize methods and generate a professional README.md for the project.
prompts.template:
Traverse all files in the {project}, extract all methods, and create a synthesis of all functions. For each method, write a concise summary in English followed by a clear code example.

Generate a concise and professional README.md file for the project {project}. The markdown should include:

- A main title with a NuGet logo/badge.
- A short introduction (2-3 sentences) explaining the general purpose of the package.
- A list of 4-5 key points describing the main benefits.
- Installation instructions (Package Manager, .NET CLI, Package Reference).
- Prerequisites (supported .NET versions).
- A structured organization of the main features with sections.
- A section on multi-platform compatibility.
- A note on the license.

The markdown must use professional formatting with:

- Hierarchical headings (#, ##, ###, etc.).
- Bullet points for lists.
- Syntax-highlighted C# code blocks for examples.
- **Bold**, *italic*, and ***bold and italic*** text for emphasis.
- ~~Strikethrough~~ and `inline code` where appropriate.

Include links formatted as:
  - [Link text](https://www.example.com)
  - [Link with title](https://www.example.com "Link title")
  - <https://www.example.com> (Direct URL).

Include images formatted as:
  - ![Alt text](image-url.jpg)
  - ![Alt text](image-url.jpg "Optional title").

Ensure the README.md is professional, well-structured, and includes clear examples in ```csharp blocks to illustrate the most important features.
